title: Wachet auf, ruft uns die Stimme, BWV 140
summary: Wachet auf, ruft uns die Stimme ('Awake, calls the voice to us'),[1] BWVÂ 140, also known as Sleepers Wake, is a church cantata by Johann Sebastian Bach, regarded as one of his most mature and popular sacred cantatas. He composed the chorale cantata in Leipzig for the 27th Sunday after Trinity and first performed it on 25 November 1731.
